sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It is Monday, the 29th of August. I'm Helena Humphrey, and here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: International nuclear watchdog, the IEA, says inspectors are en route to Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant to help secure the facility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Authorities in Pakistan declare a serious climate catastrophe as floods sweep away roads, villages and homes across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 1,000 people have been killed since June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And NASA gets ready to blast off its most powerful vehicle ever developed for a six-week mission around the moon to further its project of putting people back on the lunar surface.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UN's nuclear watchdog chief says a team is finally on its way to Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The facility has been occupied by Russian forces since February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Writing on Twitter, Rafael Grossi, director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency, said the team would arrive at the plant later this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Fighting around the facility in Ukraine's southeast has prompted concerns about a possible accident with global consequences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Both sides have accused each other of shelling the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's security services have even been taking part in exercises on managing the risk of nuclear accidents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On the front line, the constant artillery fire between the warring parties has left many people trapped, but Ukraine's embattled leader remains committed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine will come back, for sure. Life will come back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The dignity of the people of Donbass will come back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The ability to live will come back. The opportunity to live safely and happily.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is exactly what our Ukrainian flag will symbolize when we set it up in Donetsk, Gorylivka, Mariupol and in all cities of Donbas, the Azov region, in all regions under Russian occupation, in Kharkiv Oblast, Zaporizhia, Kherson Oblast and for sure in Crimea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine remembers everything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Six months into the conflict and there's still no sign of either side backing down, even as the casualties continue to mount.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: European defence ministers are meeting in Prague today for two days discussing security across the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's the first time they get together since the summer break and Ukraine is likely to dominate their agenda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: One item on the table will be the proposal of setting up a European Union military training mission for Ukrainian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Not based in Ukraine, however, but in other EU member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces, not based in Ukraine, however, but in other EU member states. Joseph Borre, the EU foreign affairs chief, took to his blog this week to express the importance of supporting Ukraine and making sure the cost of the war keeps increasing for Russia. Another topic that's likely to come up at the two-day event is the idea of introducing a visa ban on Russian tourists entering the European Union. EU member states, though, are very divided on this issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Germany against it, as well as Joseph Boré himself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: So it's unlikely it will fly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kosovo and Serbia have ended a dispute over identity documents, settling one of the problems between the estranged Balkan neighbours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Last month, Pristina said Serb-issued IDs and vehicle licence plates would no longer be valid on its territory, just as Kosovo-issued ones are not valid in Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But after a series of EU-mediated talks, Brussels says a landmark deal has been reached.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Serbia has agreed to abolish the entry-exit document for Kosovo ID holders, and Kosovo has agreed to not introduce them for Serbian ID holders. Kosovo Serbs, as well as all other citizens, will be able to travel freely between Kosovo and Serbia using the ID cards. The European Union has received guarantees from Prime Minister Gordy to this end." The announcement follows a flurry of international efforts to defuse tensions between both sides as NATO peacekeepers stepped up their presence in northern Kosovo. While the license plate matter has yet to be resolved, Brussels has called on the leaders of both territories to work towards a solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Northern Serbia has become the epicentre of a migrant crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: More than 10,000 refugees, mostly from Asia and North Africa, have made the journey to the Balkan country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Many are attempting to enter the European Union from the city of Subotica, on the border with Hungary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Despite a four-metre high fence built by Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán in 2015, border agency Frontex says more than 70,000 migrants have been detected on this border route since the beginning of January, three times the number of refugees seen in the same period last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While Hungarian authorities have been successful in pushing back some of the migrants, many are determined to find a better life further west.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: According to Austria's Ministry for the Interior, nearly 42,000 people have lodged asylum applications since the start of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In a humanitarian disaster of epic proportions, Pakistan's monsoon season triggered floods which killed over 1,000 people and injured 1,500 others. According to the government, 33 million people, or one in seven Pakistanis, have been affected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Among the dead include 348 children and 207 women, with the numbers expected to grow in the coming days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Angres Khan has been displaced due to the floods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He explains he had to leave his home after the floodwaters entered his area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He moved to save his cattle and himself, putting the children who were at home on a roof until he could evacuate them somewhere safe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Another victim said this was the same kind of flood which hit the area in the past. Houses were destroyed and rebuilt by NGOs. However, disaster struck twice and they were once again submerged and destroyed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Since mid-June, the monsoon rains have damaged almost one million homes, destroyed 80,000 hectares of arable land and washed away at least 149 bridges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Waters are now moving towards the Punjab and Sindh provinces while relief efforts are mobilizing throughout the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Relief efforts are mobilizing throughout the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This community in the Netherlands is in mourning and shock after a lorry careered off the road on Saturday into a neighborhood barbecue, killing six and injuring more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The driver is in custody, but the incident has left locals devastated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We live in another town close by, and we all heard the sirens and then we looked on the internet to see what was going on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Then you have a massive shock.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is so huge what happened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's terrible for the people but also for the driver who did this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He surely didn't do it deliberately. It's terrible. Everybody is affected and mourning with the people here. Nothing ever happens here. There are almost no thefts or anything terrible and suddenly something like this happened and everybody is suddenly on alert. Everybody is so shocked and everybody in the neighborhood has been affected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Spanish registered lorry ran off the top of a dike in a village 30 kilometers south of Rotterdam. Investigations into what caused the incident are still ongoing. What is known so far is that the driver was not intoxicated and may have been trying to avoid a collision with a van.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: and may have been trying to avoid a collision with a van.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: U.S. Space Agency NASA's Artemis I mission is still on track for a Monday morning launch, despite a series of lightning strikes on the launch pads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The unmanned Orion rocket is due to travel about 65,000 kilometers beyond the moon over the course of about six weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Our team has been excited for a really long time about what they're doing and the way in which they're supporting this program and our ability to get back to the moon and put people on the moon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And so I get to work with a lot of folks that are a lot younger than me these days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I've been around for a while.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And to see their faces and to hear their voices and the excitement that they have each and every day, because we ask a lot of folks, as a lot of the programs do, to get us to this point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And they've done an outstanding job.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Artemis is the first step in a program aiming to establish a sustainable presence on the moon to prepare for missions to Mars.
